title: Domain 4.9: Given a scenario, use remote access technologies.
content:
🧰 Methods/Tools for Remote Access

  • RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol): 🔒 Secure Windows remote control over a network.
  • VPN (Virtual Private Network): 🛡️ Encrypts traffic between a device and the network.
  • VNC (Virtual Network Computing): 🧭 Cross-platform desktop sharing; less secure than RDP.
  • SSH (Secure Shell): 🔐 Secure command-line remote access, ideal for servers and devices.
  • RMM (Remote Monitoring and Management): 🖧 Used by IT teams to oversee and control systems remotely.
  • Microsoft Remote Assistance (MSRA): 👥 Allows users to invite support staff to help remotely.
  • Third-party tools:
    • 🖥️ Screen-sharing software (e.g., TeamViewer) – for quick help or demos.
    • 🎥 Video-conferencing software (e.g., Zoom) – includes screen control.
    • 📁 File transfer software – for securely sharing files remotely.
    • 🛠️ Desktop management software – for enterprise configuration and control.

🔐 Security Considerations

  • Use strong passwords and enable multi-factor authentication (MFA).
  • Keep remote access tools up-to-date to patch vulnerabilities.
  • Restrict remote access using firewalls or IP whitelisting.
  • Monitor logs for suspicious login attempts or data transfers.
  • Always use encryption, especially for VNC or file transfer tools that may not default to secure connections.
